title: NASA's InSight Gets a Few Extra Weeks of Mars Science
summary: The mission’s team has chosen to operate its seismometer longer than previously planned, although the lander will run out of power sooner as a result.

title: NASA counts down to within 29 seconds of launching the large SLS rocket
summary: "It was a long day for the team, but I think it was a very successful day."

title: House Appropriations Committee warns of cost pressures in Space Force programs
summary: The House Appropriations Committee in a report accompanying the fiscal year 2023 defense appropriations bill warned about schedule and cost risks in Space Force acquisition programs.

title: NASA Announces Artemis Concept Awards for Nuclear Power on Moon
summary: NASA and the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) are working together to advance space nuclear technologies.

title: Through Starling, NASA will test complex swarm operations
summary: NASA is preparing to launch Starling, its first satellite swarm. Instead of communicating directly with the four Starling cubesats, mission operators will send instructions to the swarm as a single entity.

title: NASA, SpaceX to test satellite crash-prevention strategies
summary: Through the Starling mission, NASA and SpaceX will begin testing strategies for preventing autonomous satellites from crashing into each other.

title: KARI reaches orbit on second test flight of domestic Nuri rocket
summary: The Korean Aerospace Research Institute (KARI) has conducted its second launch of the Korea Space Launch Vehicle (KSLV)-II rocket, also known as Nuri. This was Nuri’s return to flight after nearly reaching orbit on its previous mission. The rocket lifted off from Launch Complex-2 (LC-2) at the Naro Space Center on June 21 at 16:00 Korea Time (07:00 UTC).

title: Sierra Space signs agreement for Dream Chaser landings at Spaceport America
summary: Sierra Space will work with Spaceport America in New Mexico to use that commercial spaceport as a potential future landing site for the company’s Dream Chaser vehicle.

title: South Korean rocket puts satellites in orbit for the first time in second flight
summary: South Korea’s homegrown rocket KSLV-2 successfully put satellites into low Earth orbit for the first time in its second flight June 21.

title: NASA approves demonstration flight for circular DiskSats
summary: NASA approved a demonstration flight for DiskSat, the thin round satellite designed by the Aerospace Corp.
